sn45.4:1.6: I keep the overly literal Brahma here to retain consistency with the similar usage at AN 3.63. I found that only by keeping the literal form was the sense retained. But I might change my mind!
sn45.4:9.1: BB has “adornment” here, but parikkhara is always, so far as I know, used in the sense of something essential, as indeed is sila.
sn45.4:9.3: The Chinese parallel at SA 769 is exact and helpful: 捨三昧為轅. see https://discourse.suttacentral.net/t/dhurasamadhi-in-sn-45-4/4157/2
